data.event: It was established in 1835, being incorporated by the Kentucky Legislature as the Town of Landing.

event.title: 1846 the name of the town was changed

data.event: In 1846 the name of the town was changed to Hamilton in honour of Joel Hamilton, the founder, who had since moved to Texas.
The limits of the town of Hamilton were extended in 1849.

event.title: 1852 a new road, the Hamilton and Union Turnpike was chartered

data.event: In 1852 a new road, the Hamilton and Union Turnpike was chartered.

event.title: chartered in the area that year

data.event: Other projects chartered in the area that year were the Napoleon and Big Bone Lick Turnpike, and the Union and Beaver Turnpike.
